data.title: Global Coastal Transect Repository (GCTR)
data.description:
A Parquet dataset containing coastal transects and derived attributes, including intersection
distances to OSM coastlines at multiple bearings and shoreline change rates from the ShorelineMonitor dataset.

table:columns.name: transect_id
table:columns.description: Unique identifier for each transect, constructed from coastline, segment, and distance.

table:columns.name: lon
table:columns.description: Longitude coordinate of the transect origin.

table:columns.name: lat
table:columns.description: Latitude coordinate of the transect origin.

table:columns.name: bearing
table:columns.description: Bearing angle of the transect, measured clockwise from the north.

table:columns.name: geometry
table:columns.description: Transect geometry as a Well-Known Binary (WKB) LineString.

table:columns.name: osm_coastline_is_closed
table:columns.description: Indicates whether the source OpenStreetMap coastline forms a closed loop (e.g., an island).

table:columns.name: osm_coastline_length
table:columns.description: Total length of the source OpenStreetMap coastline in meters, summed across UTM zones.

table:columns.name: utm_epsg
table:columns.description: EPSG code representing the UTM Coordinate Reference System of the transect.

table:columns.name: bbox
table:columns.description: Bounding box of the transect geometry, defined by minimum and maximum x (longitude) and y (latitude) coordinates.

table:columns.name: quadkey
table:columns.description: Spatial index for the transect origin, following the Bing Maps Tile System.

table:columns.name: continent
table:columns.description: Name of the continent where the transect is located.

table:columns.name: country
table:columns.description: ISO alpha-2 country code for the transect's location.

table:columns.name: common_country_name
table:columns.description: Common name of the country where the transect is located.

table:columns.name: common_region_name
table:columns.description: Common name of the region where the transect is located.

table:columns.name: dist_b0
table:columns.description: Distance (m) from the transect origin to the nearest OpenStreetMap coastline intersection at bearing 0°.

table:columns.name: dist_b30
table:columns.description: Distance (m) from the transect origin to the nearest OpenStreetMap coastline intersection at bearing 30°.

table:columns.name: dist_b60
table:columns.description: Distance (m) from the transect origin to the nearest OpenStreetMap coastline intersection at bearing 60°.

table:columns.name: dist_b90
table:columns.description: Distance (m) from the transect origin to the nearest OpenStreetMap coastline intersection at bearing 90°.

table:columns.name: dist_b120
table:columns.description: Distance (m) from the transect origin to the nearest OpenStreetMap coastline intersection at bearing 120°.

table:columns.name: dist_b150
table:columns.description: Distance (m) from the transect origin to the nearest OpenStreetMap coastline intersection at bearing 150°.

table:columns.name: dist_b180
table:columns.description: Distance (m) from the transect origin to the nearest OpenStreetMap coastline intersection at bearing 180°.

table:columns.name: dist_b210
table:columns.description: Distance (m) from the transect origin to the nearest OpenStreetMap coastline intersection at bearing 210°.

table:columns.name: dist_b240
table:columns.description: Distance (m) from the transect origin to the nearest OpenStreetMap coastline intersection at bearing 240°.

table:columns.name: dist_b270
table:columns.description: Distance (m) from the transect origin to the nearest OpenStreetMap coastline intersection at bearing 270°.

table:columns.name: dist_b300
table:columns.description: Distance (m) from the transect origin to the nearest OpenStreetMap coastline intersection at bearing 300°.

table:columns.name: dist_b330
table:columns.description: Distance (m) from the transect origin to the nearest OpenStreetMap coastline intersection at bearing 330°.

table:columns.name: sds:start_datetime
table:columns.description: Start date of the observation period used for trend estimation.

table:columns.name: sds:end_datetime
table:columns.description: End date of the observation period used for trend estimation.

table:columns.name: sds:reference_datetime
table:columns.description: Reference year used to compute shoreline chainage.

table:columns.name: sds:reference_lon
table:columns.description: Longitude coordinate of the reference shoreline observation.

table:columns.name: sds:reference_lat
table:columns.description: Latitude coordinate of the reference shoreline observation.

table:columns.name: sds:change_rate
table:columns.description: Rate of shoreline change (m/year) derived from satellite-derived shorelines (SDS).

table:columns.name: sds:change_intercept
table:columns.description: Intercept of the linear trend line fitted to the shoreline time series (in meters).

table:columns.name: sds:change_rate_std_err
table:columns.description: Standard error of the estimated shoreline change rate.

table:columns.name: sds:r_squared
table:columns.description: R² value of the linear trend fit, indicating the goodness of fit.

table:columns.name: sds:obs_primary_count
table:columns.description: Count of primary observations in the group.

table:columns.name: sds:tr_stdev
table:columns.description: Standard deviation of shoreline positions across the transect.

table:columns.name: sds:tr_range
table:columns.description: Range (max - min) of shoreline positions along the transect.

table:columns.name: sds:tr_qa_pct
table:columns.description: Percentage of observations in the transect that passed quality assurance checks.

table:columns.name: sds:tr_is_qa
table:columns.description: Flag indicating whether the transect meets quality assurance criteria; a combination of minimum observations per year and standard deviation.

table:columns.name: class:shore_type
table:columns.description: Predicted shore type classification, which describes the material composing the shore (e.g., sandy sediments, rocky formations, or muddy sediments).

table:columns.name: class:coastal_type
table:columns.description: Predicted coastal type classification, which refers to the geomorphological features of the coast, which may be natural (e.g., cliffs, dunes) or human-influenced (e.g., engineered structures).

table:columns.name: class:has_defense
table:columns.description: Boolean flag indicating whether coastal defense structures (e.g., sea walls, breakwaters) are present to protect against erosion and flooding.

table:columns.name: class:is_built_environment
table:columns.description: Boolean flag indicating whether the coastal area is dominated by human-made structures or remains largely natural.

table:columns.name: class:prob_sandy_gravel_or_small_boulder_sediments
table:columns.description: Model confidence (probability between 0 and 1) that the shore is composed of sandy sediments, gravel, or small boulders. Derived from the shore type classification.

table:columns.name: class:prob_muddy_sediments
table:columns.description: Model confidence (probability between 0 and 1) that the shore is composed of muddy sediments. Derived from the shore type classification.

table:columns.name: class:prob_rocky_shore_platform_or_large_boulders
table:columns.description: Model confidence (probability between 0 and 1) that the shore consists of rocky platforms or large boulders. Derived from the shore type classification.

table:columns.name: class:prob_no_sediment_or_shore_platform
table:columns.description: Model confidence (probability between 0 and 1) that the shore lacks sediment and consists mainly of shore platform features. Derived from the shore type classification.

table:columns.name: class:prob_cliffed_or_steep
table:columns.description: Model confidence (probability between 0 and 1) that the coast is cliffed or steep. Derived from the coastal type classification.

table:columns.name: class:prob_moderately_sloped
table:columns.description: Model confidence (probability between 0 and 1) that the coast is moderately sloped. Derived from the coastal type classification.

table:columns.name: class:prob_bedrock_plain
table:columns.description: Model confidence (probability between 0 and 1) that the coast is characterized by a bedrock plain. Derived from the coastal type classification.

table:columns.name: class:prob_sediment_plain
table:columns.description: Model confidence (probability between 0 and 1) that the coast is characterized by a sediment plain. Derived from the coastal type classification.

table:columns.name: class:prob_dune
table:columns.description: Model confidence (probability between 0 and 1) that the coast contains dune systems. Derived from the coastal type classification.

table:columns.name: class:prob_wetland
table:columns.description: Model confidence (probability between 0 and 1) that the coast includes wetland environments. Derived from the coastal type classification.

table:columns.name: class:prob_inlet
table:columns.description: Model confidence (probability between 0 and 1) that the coast contains an inlet or estuarine feature. Derived from the coastal type classification.

table:columns.name: class:prob_engineered_structures
table:columns.description: Model confidence (probability between 0 and 1) that the coast includes engineered structures. Derived from the coastal type classification.

table:columns.name: class:prob_has_defense
table:columns.description: Model confidence (probability between 0 and 1) that coastal defense structures are present. Complements the binary 'class:has_defense' label.

table:columns.name: class:prob_is_built_environment
table:columns.description: Model confidence (probability between 0 and 1) that the coastal area is built-up or dominated by human-made infrastructure. Complements the binary 'class:is_built_environment' label.

table:columns.name: class:model
table:columns.description: Identifier for the machine learning model used for coastal typology predictions.

table:columns.name: class:datetime_created
table:columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the coastal typology predictions were generated.

table:columns.name: ar6:ssp1-26_2030
table:columns.description: Projected relative sea level rise (in meters) for SSP1-2.6 in year 2030, represented as an array of 100 percentiles (1st to 100th) from the AR6 ensemble.

table:columns.name: ar6:ssp1-26_2050
table:columns.description: Projected relative sea level rise (in meters) for SSP1-2.6 in year 2050, represented as an array of 100 percentiles (1st to 100th) from the AR6 ensemble.

table:columns.name: ar6:ssp1-26_2100
table:columns.description: Projected relative sea level rise (in meters) for SSP1-2.6 in year 2100, represented as an array of 100 percentiles (1st to 100th) from the AR6 ensemble.

table:columns.name: ar6:ssp2-45_2030
table:columns.description: Projected relative sea level rise (in meters) for SSP2-4.5 in year 2030, represented as an array of 100 percentiles (1st to 100th) from the AR6 ensemble.

table:columns.name: ar6:ssp2-45_2050
table:columns.description: Projected relative sea level rise (in meters) for SSP2-4.5 in year 2050, represented as an array of 100 percentiles (1st to 100th) from the AR6 ensemble.

table:columns.name: ar6:ssp2-45_2100
table:columns.description: Projected relative sea level rise (in meters) for SSP2-4.5 in year 2100, represented as an array of 100 percentiles (1st to 100th) from the AR6 ensemble.

table:columns.name: ar6:ssp5-85_2030
table:columns.description: Projected relative sea level rise (in meters) for SSP5-8.5 in year 2030, represented as an array of 100 percentiles (1st to 100th) from the AR6 ensemble.

table:columns.name: ar6:ssp5-85_2050
table:columns.description: Projected relative sea level rise (in meters) for SSP5-8.5 in year 2050, represented as an array of 100 percentiles (1st to 100th) from the AR6 ensemble.

table:columns.name: ar6:ssp5-85_2100
table:columns.description: Projected relative sea level rise (in meters) for SSP5-8.5 in year 2100, represented as an array of 100 percentiles (1st to 100th) from the AR6 ensemble.

table:columns.name: ar6:sjoin_distance
table:columns.description: Distance in meters between the transect origin and the nearest AR6 raster pixel used for sea level rise projection.

table:columns.name: gcc:ns
table:columns.description: GCC nearshore slope calculated between the depth of closure and the shoreline point.

table:columns.name: gcc:bs_deltadtm
table:columns.description: GCC backshore slope derived from the shoreline to the coastal max (first elevation peak) using DeltaDTM elevation data (DOI: 10.1038/s41597-024-03091-9).

table:columns.name: gcc:bs_copdem
table:columns.description: GCC backshore slope derived from the shoreline to the coastal max (first elevation peak) using Copernicus DEM data (DOI: 10.5270/ESA-c5d3d65).

table:columns.name: gcc:cs_deltadtm
table:columns.description: GCC coastal slope derived from the depth of closure to the coastal max (first elevation peak) using DeltaDTM elevation data (DOI: 10.1038/s41597-024-03091-9).

table:columns.name: gcc:cs_copdem
table:columns.description: GCC coastal slope derived from the depth of closure to the coastal max (first elevation peak) using Copernicus DEM data (DOI: 10.5270/ESA-c5d3d65).

table:columns.name: gcc:sjoin_distance
table:columns.description: Distance in meters between the transect origin and the nearest GCC station.

table:columns.name: buildings:dist_to_shoreline
table:columns.description: Distance in meters from the nearest Overture building footprint to the satellite-derived shoreline (SDS reference point) along the transect direction.

table:columns.name: buildings:dist_to_transect_origin
table:columns.description: Distance in meters from the nearest Overture building footprint to the transect origin (GCTS point) along the transect direction.

table:columns.name: buildings:count_intersections
table:columns.description: Number of Overture building footprints that intersect the transect area, defined as a buffer extending 50 meters alongshore in both directions.

table:columns.name: buildings:area_total
table:columns.description: Total area (in square meters) of Overture building footprints that intersect the transect area, defined as a buffer extending 50 meters alongshore in both directions.
